title: User can view all nearby vendors and establishment's
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user enters the mobile food ordering section from the BallPark app
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on "Start Ordering Food"
custom_expected:
THEN, all food vendors and establishments with their name and location are displayed
AND a search field is displayed on top of the page
AND the location dropdown for user to filter vendor by location is displayed
AND each vendor and establishment have their descriptor of food
AND the food description is Ellipsis to fit as needed
AND the back arrow button is pinned to the top left corner.

title: Location dropdown menu
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user is on the food vendors and establishment's page
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on the location dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN, location drop down menu slides up and displays
AND the location drop down menu has the following:
-"X" button on top left corner to close the location drop down menu
-Location header pinned to the top
-3 Sub-sections which user can filter location by (LEVELS, SECTIONS, LANDMARKS)

title: User can filter vendor and establishment's by selecting the location dropdown
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user is on the food vendor and establishment's list view page
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on the Location drop down
custom_expected:
THEN, a user can filter vendors by their location around the park
AND a user has the option to filter by levels, sections, and landmarks
AND a user can select any option to view food vendors based on levels, sections, landmarks

title: User can select a food vendor and the establishment's detail and menu
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user enters the mobile food ordering section from the BallPark app
AND a user taps on "Start Ordering Food"
custom_steps: WHEN a user selects food vendor from the list populated
custom_expected: THEN, a menu from a food vendor selected is displayed

title: Specific food vendor detail and menu
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user enters the mobile food ordering section from the BallPark app
AND a user taps on "Start Ordering Food"
custom_steps: WHEN a user select a specific food vendor
custom_expected:
THEN, menu from the vendor selected is displayed
AND the menu list is scrollable
AND the menu list is broken up into predefined categories
AND price of each food item is displayed
AND the food item can be tapped to enter into a detailed view
AND a back button is available on top left corner.

title: User is able to navigate back to food vendor and establishment's list from vendor's menu page
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user is on a specific food vendor menu page
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps the "Back" arrow button on top left corner
custom_expected: THEN, a user is brought back to the list of all food vendor and establishments around the park.

title: Food item detailed view
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user has selected a specific food vendor
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on any of the food items
custom_expected:
THEN, a detailed view of the food item tapped slides up and displays
AND detailed view has the following:
-Quantity w/ add or subtract buttons
-Add to cart button
-"X" button to close item detailed view

title: User is able to adjust the item quantity
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user has selected an item from the menu
AND a user is on the item detail page
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on the "+" or the "-" buttons under quantity
custom_expected:
THEN, a user is able to adjust the quantity of the item
AND each tap will increment or decrement by one.

title: User is able to close the food item detailed view page
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user is in the food item detailed view page
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on the "X" button displayed on the top left corner
custom_expected:
THEN, the food item detail view slides down and closes
AND the user is back to the vendor menu page

title: User is able to see which food item(s) is available to purchase
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user scrolls through the menu
custom_expected: THEN the user will see each item that is available at that specific venue

title: User is able to jump between categories in the menu *
User is able to dismiss the category browser by tapping anywhere outside the category browser *
User is able to navigated back to the Welcome screen from vendors page
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user is on the food vendors and establishment's page
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on the back button that's pinned to the top left corner of the page
custom_expected: THEN, a user is navigated back to the main/welcome screen.

title: User gets notification if an item being added to cart is unavailable *
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user has selected a food vendor
AND a user is viewing the vendor's menu
AND an item a user selects is not available
custom_steps: WHEN a user selects an item from the menu and add to cart
custom_expected:
THEN, a single button notification will display
AND text states: Sorry, that item is temporarily unavailable from this vendor
AND tapping the "Okay" button takes a user to the previous screen without modifying cart.

title: Adding restricted item(s) to the cart warning/notification
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user is has selected a food vendor
AND a user is viewing menu from that food vendor
custom_steps: WHEN a user add a restricted item(s) (e.g. alcohol) to the cart
custom_expected:
THEN, a double button warning/notification is displayed that details any additional requirements
AND Text states: Picking up alcohol requires guests to present one valid 21+ photo ID for each beverage.
-Accept and Confirm button is displayed
-Cancel button is displayed
AND tapping cancel button takes a user to the previous screen and does not modify cart.  i.e alcohol not added.

title: Food item caloric represntation
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user has selected food vendor to order food from
custom_steps:
WHEN a user is viewing the menu
AND a user selects a specific item from the menu
OR Calorie key/value is missing or calorie value returned is null or non-integer
custom_expected:
THEN, each item will display calorie information next to the item price amount
OR
Display text: "No calorie information provided"

title: Menu item quantity restriction/limit notification (i.e Max quantity limit = 100)
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user has food vendor selected
AND a user is viewing the menu
AND a user tries to increase quantity beyond the max limit
AND a user tries to add items to the cart exceeding restricted quantity limit
custom_steps:
WHEN a user attempt to increase quantity beyond the max limit
AND a user attempts to add items to cart
custom_expected:
THEN, a single button notification is triggered upon increasing quantity beyond the max limit
AND the items will not be added
AND text will display "Sorry, there is a limit of {#} {item name} per order"
AND tapping Okay button takes user to previous screen without modifying cart.

title: Total cost is updated as quantity is updated
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user has selected an item from a menu
AND a user is on the item detailed page
custom_steps: WHEN a user adjust the quantity of the item by either adding or subtracting
custom_expected: THEN, a user will see the price cost of that item update in the add to cart button

title: View cart button is active and visible on all pages after at least one item has been added to the cart
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user has at least one item in the cart
custom_steps: WHEN a user navigates to the other parts of the app such as Menu page, Vendor list view, Welcome screen etc...
custom_expected:
THEN, a "View Cart" button is active and displayed on all those parts of the app
AND a user can tap on "View Cart" button to view cart

title: Cart View
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user has at least one item added to the cart
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on the "View Cart" button
custom_expected:
THEN, a cart view slides up and display the following:
-"X" button to close cart view
-"Cart" header
-Vendor/Establishment's name and location
-Add more item
-Preferred card of mlb.com text
-Payment method
-Order details
-Edit button
-Order Summary
-Total
-Tax Disclaimer text
-Place order button (Greyed out until user enters payment method)

title: Tapping "X" close button from Cart View takes user back to the page a user was on prior to tapping "View Cart"
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user has at least one item added to the cart
AND a user has navigated back to the Welcome screen
OR a user has navigated back to the vendor/establishment's list view page
OR a user has navigated back to the menu page
custom_steps:
WHEN a user taps "View Cart" button from any of those sections
AND taps "X" button on top left corner to close cart view
custom_expected:
THEN, a cart view will slide up and display item added to the cart
AND upon closing cart view, a user is taken back to the page a user originally engaged "view cart" button from.

title: User is able to delete item from the cart
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user has at least one item added to the cart
AND a user is in the cart view
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps "Edit" or Slides left on a specific item
custom_expected:
THEN, delete item button is displayed
AND a user is able to delete that item from their cart

title: "Edit" button changes to "Done" when a user taps on it - Cart View
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user has at least one item added to the cart
AND a user is viewing the cart
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on "Edit" from the Order Details section to delete item from the cart
custom_expected: THEN, the "Edit" button changes to "Done" and vise versa.

title: Menu failure to load notification
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user is on the food vendor/ establishment's list view page
custom_steps:
WHEN a user taps a vendor to view menu
AND the vendor's food menu has failed to load
custom_expected:
THEN, a single button text prompt will display after 10 seconds letting the user know what has occured
AND the Text states: "Could not load menu items. Please Try Again later.
AND Tapping Okay button dismisses notification box and returns the user back to the results list.

title: When there is no item in the cart - Empty cart
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user has at least one item added to the cart
AND a user views the cart
custom_steps:
WHEN a user deletes item from the cart
AND there are no other item left in the cart
custom_expected:
THEN, a cart view will show an image of a hot dog
AND a text below the image will read "You have no items in your cart."

title: Payment Method page
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user has at least one item added to cart
AND a user is ready to place order
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on Payment method
custom_expected:
THEN, a user is able to add card
AND a user is given the option to pay with Apple pay
AND a user can tap back to go back to the cart

title: User can add or delete payment methods
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user is ready to place order
AND a user has already added a payment method
custom_steps:
WHEN a user taps "Edit" button on the top right corner
AND a user taps "Add Card" button
custom_expected:
THEN, a user is able to edit their existing payment method information
AND a user is able to delete their payment methods
AND a user is able to add a new payment method.

title: User is able to add more than one payment methods
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user has at least one item added to cart
AND a user has previously added a payment method
custom_steps:
WHEN a user taps on payment method in the cart view
AND a user "Add Card" button
custom_expected:
THEN, a user sees the previously added payment method under payment methods
AND a user is able to add more than one payment method

title: Place Order button is inactive until payment method is added
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user is in the cart view
custom_steps:
WHEN a user is ready to place order
AND a user has no payment methods setup
custom_expected:
THEN, place order button is by default grayed out
AND a user is not able to tap the place order button

title: User is able to tap Place order button and place their order
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user is in the cart view and ready to place order
custom_steps: WHEN a user adds the payment method
custom_expected:
THEN, place order button turns active/green
AND a user is able to tap the place order button to process their order.

title: NO calorie information should display
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the items
custom_expected: THEN no calorie information should display
